document.discussion_title: Texan woman gives up liver meant for...
document.topic_text: Texan woman gives up liver meant for her to save stranger Sheeka Sanahori, USA TODAY , WTSP 7:30 PM. EST August 11, 2016 Brenda Jones, 69, opted to put herself back on the waiting list for a liver transplant in order to save the life of Abigail Flores. CONNECT TWEET PINTEREST DALLAS - After waiting a year to get to the top of the waiting list for a new liver, a woman made an incredible sacrifice for a stranger, one that doctors said they'd never seen before. Brenda Jones, 69, opted to put herself back on the waiting list for a liver transplant in order to save the life of another woman who had a more urgent need. Doctors believed that Abigail Flores, 23, had at most 24 hours to live if she didn't get a new liver. “The judgment behind it seemed very clear, but it still felt unorthodox nonetheless,” said Dr. Greg McKenna, a Baylor Hospital surgeon. The liver was a match for both women. Jones said it was easy for her to make the decision to give the liver to Flores. “In my heart, I wouldn’t have been able to live with the liver if I had let this little girl die," Jones said. "And I still had more time ... I would have been a very selfish person." Jones was able to get a liver transplant a few days later. Both women are now recovering from their transplant surgeries. "If it wasn’t for her, I wouldn’t be sitting right here right now," Flores said. "I thank God for her each and every day." (© 2016 KHOU)
